text:
“I will be arrested soon,” he said, worry etched on his face.  
“They’ll let me out again. No real proof against me.”  
Sonia’s eyes filled with tears. “Oh, I will visit you in prison.”  
They sat together, silent and heavy-hearted.  
He felt her love, yet it felt like a burden.  
“Don’t come to see me,” he murmured.  
Sonia cried, her heart breaking.  
“Do you have a cross?” she asked suddenly.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with the burden of his crime and the pain of Sonia's love, feeling increasingly isolated and unhappy despite her support.
